Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of car thefts increasing in 8 of the 10 most populous Wisconsin counties, as there are two counties (Milwaukee and Kenosha) that actually had decreases in car thefts.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it does not provide specific data or statistics to back up the assertion that car thefts are increasing in the mentioned counties.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the assumption that car thefts in 8 of the 10 most populous Wisconsin counties are increasing without considering other factors or alternative explanations for the reported increases.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may not consider alternative explanations for the reported increases in car thefts, such as changes in reporting methods or law enforcement efforts.
